1103765373235744768.text: For what's called Ellipitic function fields the Zeta function turns out to be extremely simple - essentially a degree two poly Z!(after omitting some term). Each E.C. has a field matching to it, and the difference N-q between curve and field size is the sum of the roots of Z

1103763784223592449.text: People noticed you could define a Zeta function for other fields: The rational numbers have integers which are uses to define Zeta(s) in the infinite sum; but many other fields have something called *integral divisors* that can be used to define a Zeta function for that field

1103762794401402880.text: This meant determining where these zeroes are is very interesting; and the Riemann Hypothesis is about proving almost all of them have real part 1/2. This question turned out to be extremely hard, perhaps because of that people looked for easier versions of the RH to prove

1103762384500461568.text: Riemann defined the zeta function at s using the infinite sum zeta(s) = sum_n 1/n^s. He showed you could define it for every complex s even when the sum doesn't converge, and that THE ZEROES OF THE FUNCTION GIVE YOU AN EXACT FORMULA FOR WHEN THE NEXT PRIME WILL APPEAR!

1103761257851744264.text: I've recently understood to a degree, Hasse's proof that an ellipitic curve over Fq has roughly q points up to 2sqrt(q) factor; here is an attempt to summarize it in a few tweets -(thanks a lot to these two amazing books  https://www.amazon.com/Hypothesis-Characteristic-Historical-Perspective-Mathematics/dp/3319990667/ref=sr_1_fkmrnull_1?crid=V6HQPT1ETDHQ&keywords=the+riemann+hypothesis+in+characteristic+p+in+historical+perspective&qid=1547811761&sprefix=the+riemann+hypothesis+in+characteristic+p+in+hist%2Cdigital-text%2C275&sr=8-1-fkmrnull … https://www.amazon.com/Elliptic-Curves-Cryptography-Mathematics-Applications/dp/1420071467 …)

1008720855751430145.text: Bitcoin works in the ideal model of total asynchronicity. Seems recent attacks can be avoided by making reasonable synchronicity assumptions; e.g. , if you want me to roll back t-blocks to your chain, show me PoW that is t times larger.

1007987717890863104.text: Amazing the mental effort required to cancel things. Just canceled a vpn I was paying for about a year, that only used once.

1004796483638476800.text: Like I head @VitalikButerin say once, and I realize with the recent DS attacks, the cost of an adversary in bitcoin/PoW is not high enough compared to cost of honest player. Partial synchronicity assumptions might solve this.

1004796006838333440.text: Is someone looking into partially synchronous PoW? That is, if you want to convince me to roll back x blocks, you have to show me PoW that's larger than the current chain by a factor depending on x. Could help with double spend.
